event.name: OnHtmlCellClicked
event.help: A wxHtmlCell was clicked.

event.name: OnHtmlCellHover
event.help: The mouse passed over a wxHtmlCell.

event.name: OnHtmlLinkClicked
event.help: A wxHtmlCell which contains an hyperlink was clicked.

option.name: wxTE_PROCESS_ENTER
option.help: The control will generate the event wxEVT_COMMAND_TEXT_ENTER (otherwise pressing Enter key is either processed internally by the control or used for navigation between dialog controls).

option.name: wxTE_PROCESS_TAB
option.help: The control will receive wxEVT_CHAR events for TAB pressed - normally, TAB is used for passing to the next control in a dialog instead. For the control created with this style, you can still use Ctrl-Enter to pass to the next control from the keyboard.

option.name: wxTE_READONLY
option.help: The text will not be user-editable.

option.name: wxTE_AUTO_URL
option.help: Highlight the URLs and generate the wxTextUrl events when mouse events occur over them.

event.name: OnText
event.help: Respond to a wxEVT_COMMAND_TEXT_UPDATED event, generated when the text changes. Notice that this event will always be sent when the text controls contents changes - whether this is due to user input or comes from the program itself (for example, if SetValue() is called)

event.name: OnTextEnter
event.help: Respond to a wxEVT_COMMAND_TEXT_ENTER event, generated when enter is pressed in a text control (which must have wxTE_PROCESS_ENTER style for this event to be generated).

event.name: OnTextURL
event.help: A mouse event occurred over an URL in the text control (wxMSW and wxGTK2 only)

event.name: OnTextMaxLen
event.help: User tried to enter more text into the control than the limit set by SetMaxLength.

event.name: OnRichTextCharacter
event.help: Process a wxEVT_COMMAND_RICHTEXT_CHARACTER event, generated when the user presses a character key. Valid event functions: GetFlags, GetPosition, GetCharacter.

event.name: OnRichTextDelete
event.help: Process a wxEVT_COMMAND_RICHTEXT_DELETE event, generated when the user presses the backspace or delete key. Valid event functions: GetFlags, GetPosition.

event.name: OnRichTextReturn
event.help: Process a wxEVT_COMMAND_RICHTEXT_RETURN event, generated when the user presses the return key. Valid event functions: GetFlags, GetPosition.

event.name: OnRichTextStyleChanged
event.help: Process a wxEVT_COMMAND_RICHTEXT_STYLE_CHANGED event, generated when styling has been applied to the control. Valid event functions: GetPosition, GetRange.

event.name: OnRichTextStyleSheetChanged
event.help: Process a wxEVT_COMMAND_RICHTEXT_STYLESHEET_CHANGING event, generated when the control's stylesheet has changed, for example the user added, edited or deleted a style. Valid event functions: GetRange, GetPosition.

event.name: OnRichTextStyleSheetReplacing
event.help: Process a wxEVT_COMMAND_RICHTEXT_STYLESHEET_REPLACING event, generated when the control's stylesheet is about to be replaced, for example when a file is loaded into the control. Valid event functions: Veto, GetOldStyleSheet, GetNewStyleSheet.

event.name: OnRichTextStyleSheetReplaced
event.help: Process a wxEVT_COMMAND_RICHTEXT_STYLESHEET_REPLACED event, generated when the control's stylesheet has been replaced, for example when a file is loaded into the control. Valid event functions: GetOldStyleSheet, GetNewStyleSheet.

event.name: OnRichTextContentInserted
event.help: Process a wxEVT_COMMAND_RICHTEXT_CONTENT_INSERTED event, generated when content has been inserted into the control. Valid event functions: GetPosition, GetRange.

event.name: OnRichTextContentDeleted
event.help: Process a wxEVT_COMMAND_RICHTEXT_CONTENT_DELETED event, generated when content has been deleted from the control. Valid event functions: GetPosition, GetRange.

property.name: folding
property.help: Enable folding.

property.name: line_numbers
property.help: Show line numbers.

property.name: indentation_guides
property.help: Show indentation guides.

property.name: tab_indents
property.help: The tab key always indents, use tabs or spaces, instead of always inserting a tab character.

property.name: backspace_unindents
property.help: The backspace key unindents, instead of just deleting one space.

property.name: view_eol
property.help: Show end of line characters.

property.name: view_whitespace
property.help: Show whitespace characters.

property.name: use_tabs
property.help: Use tabs for indenting, instead of spaces.

property.name: tab_width
property.help: The number of spaces per tab character.

event.name: OnToggleButton
event.help: Handles a wxEVT_TOGGLEBUTTON event.

option.name: wxTE_PROCESS_ENTER
option.help: The control will generate the event wxEVT_COMMAND_TEXT_ENTER (otherwise pressing Enter key is either processed internally by the control or used for navigation between dialog controls).

option.name: wxTE_PROCESS_TAB
option.help: The control will receive wxEVT_CHAR events for TAB pressed - normally, TAB is used for passing to the next control in a dialog instead. For the control created with this style, you can still use Ctrl-Enter to pass to the next control from the keyboard.

option.name: wxTE_NOHIDESEL
option.help: By default, the Windows text control doesn't show the selection when it doesn't have focus - use this style to force it to always show it. It doesn't do anything under other platforms.

option.name: wxTE_LEFT
option.help: The text in the control will be left-justified (default).

option.name: wxTE_CENTER
option.help: The text in the control will be centered (currently wxMSW and wxGTK2 only).

option.name: wxTE_RIGHT
option.help: The text in the control will be right-justified (currently wxMSW and wxGTK2 only).

option.name: wxTE_CAPITALIZE
option.help: On PocketPC and Smartphone, causes the first letter to be capitalized.

property.name: search_button
property.help: Shows or hides the search button.

property.name: cancel_button
property.help: Shows or hides the cancel button.

event.name: OnText
event.help: Respond to a wxEVT_COMMAND_TEXT_UPDATED event, generated when the text changes. Notice that this event will always be sent when the text controls contents changes - whether this is due to user input or comes from the program itself (for example, if SetValue() is called)

event.name: OnTextEnter
event.help: Respond to a wxEVT_COMMAND_TEXT_ENTER event, generated when enter is pressed in a text control (which must have wxTE_PROCESS_ENTER style for this event to be generated).

event.name: OnSearchButton
event.help: Respond to a wxEVT_SEARCHCTRL_SEARCH_BTN event, generated when the search button is clicked. Note that this does not initiate a search on its own, you need to perform the appropriate action in your event handler. You may use event.GetString() to retrieve the string to search for in the event handler code.

event.name: OnCancelButton
event.help: Respond to a wxEVT_SEARCHCTRL_CANCEL_BTN event, generated when the cancel button is clicked.

event.name: OnColourChanged
event.help: The user changed the colour selected in the control either using the button or using text control (see wxCLRP_USE_TEXTCTRL; note that in this case the event is fired only if the user's input is valid, i.e. recognizable).

property.name: max_point_size
property.help: Sets the maximum point size value allowed for the user-chosen font. The default value is 100. Note that big fonts can require a lot of memory and CPU time both for creation and for rendering; thus, specially because the user has the option to specify the fontsize through a text control (see wxFNTP_USE_TEXTCTRL), it's a good idea to put a limit to the maximum font size when huge fonts do not make much sense.

event.name: OnFontChanged
event.help: The user changed the font selected in the control either using the button or using text control (see wxFNTP_USE_TEXTCTRL; note that in this case the event is fired only if the user's input is valid, i.e. recognizable).

event.name: OnFileChanged
event.help: The user changed the file selected in the control either using the button or using text control (see wxFLP_USE_TEXTCTRL; note that in this case the event is fired only if the user's input is valid, e.g. an existing file path if wxFLP_FILE_MUST_EXIST was given).

event.name: OnDirChanged
event.help: The user changed the directory selected in the control either using the button or using text control (see wxDIRP_USE_TEXTCTRL; note that in this case the event is fired only if the user's input is valid, e.g. an existing directory path).

event.name: OnDateChanged
event.help: This event fires when the user changes the current selection in the control.

event.name: OnTimeChanged
event.help: This event fires when the user changes the current selection in the control.

event.name: OnCalendar
event.help: A day was double clicked in the calendar.

event.name: OnCalendarSelChanged
event.help: The selected date changed.

event.name: OnCalendarPageChanged
event.help: The selected month (and/or year) changed.

event.name: OnCalendarDay
event.help: The selected day changed.

event.name: OnCalendarMonth
event.help: The selected month changed.

event.name: OnCalendarYear
event.help: The selected year changed.

event.name: OnCalendarWeekDayClicked
event.help: User clicked on the week day header (only generic).

event.name: OnCalendarWeekClicked
event.help: User clicked on the week of the year number (only generic).

property.name: value
property.help: The position of the scrollbar in scroll units.

property.name: range
property.help: The maximum position of the scrollbar.

property.name: thumbsize
property.help: The size of the thumb, or visible portion of the scrollbar, in scroll units.

property.name: pagesize
property.help: This is the number of scroll units that will be scrolled when the user pages up or down.

event.name: OnScroll
event.help: Process all scroll events.

event.name: OnScrollTop
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_TOP scroll-to-top events (minimum position).

event.name: OnScrollBottom
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_BOTTOM scroll-to-bottom events (maximum position).

event.name: OnScrollLineUp
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_LINEUP line up events.

event.name: OnScrollLineDown
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_LINEDOWN line down events.

event.name: OnScrollPageUp
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_PAGEUP page up events.

event.name: OnScrollPageDown
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_PAGEDOWN page down events.

event.name: OnScrollThumbTrack
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_THUMBTRACK thumbtrack events (frequent events sent as the user drags the thumbtrack).

event.name: OnScrollThumbRelease
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_THUMBRELEASE thumb release events.

event.name: OnScrollChanged
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_CHANGED end of scrolling events (MSW only).

event.name: OnCommandScroll
event.help: Process all scroll events. Variant taking a window identifier.

event.name: OnCommandScrollTop
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_TOP scroll-to-top events (minimum position). Variant taking a window identifier.

event.name: OnCommandScrollBottom
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_BOTTOM scroll-to-bottom events (maximum position). Variant taking a window identifier.

event.name: OnCommandScrollLineUp
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_LINEUP line up events. Variant taking a window identifier.

event.name: OnCommandScrollLineDown
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_LINEDOWN line down events. Variant taking a window identifier.

event.name: OnCommandScrollPageUp
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_PAGEUP page up events. Variant taking a window identifier.

event.name: OnCommandScrollPageDown
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_PAGEDOWN page down events. Variant taking a window identifier.

event.name: OnCommandScrollThumbTrack
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_THUMBTRACK thumbtrack events (frequent events sent as the user drags the thumbtrack). Variant taking a window identifier.

event.name: OnCommandScrollThumbRelease
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_THUMBRELEASE thumb release events. Variant taking a window identifier.

event.name: OnCommandScrollChanged
event.help: Process wxEVT_SCROLL_CHANGED end of scrolling events (MSW only). Variant taking a window identifier.

property.name: min
property.help: Minimal value.

property.name: max
property.help: Maximal value.

property.name: initial
property.help: Initial value.

event.name: OnSpinCtrl
event.help: Generated whenever the numeric value of the spinctrl is updated.

event.name: OnSpinCtrlText
event.help: Generated whenever the user modifies the text in the edit part of the spin control directly.

event.name: OnTextEnter
event.help: Respond to a wxEVT_COMMAND_TEXT_ENTER event, generated when enter is pressed in the edit part of the spin control (which must have wxTE_PROCESS_ENTER style for this event to be generated).

property.name: min
property.help: Minimal value.

property.name: max
property.help: Maximal value.

property.name: initial
property.help: Initial value.

property.name: inc
property.help: Increment value.

property.name: digits
property.help: The number of digits in the display.

event.name: OnSpinCtrlDouble
event.help: Generated whenever the numeric value of the control is updated.

event.name: OnSpinCtrlText
event.help: Generated whenever the user modifies the text in the edit part of the spin control directly.

event.name: OnTextEnter
event.help: Respond to a wxEVT_COMMAND_TEXT_ENTER event, generated when enter is pressed in the edit part of the spin control (which must have wxTE_PROCESS_ENTER style for this event to be generated).

option.name: wxSP_HORIZONTAL
option.help: Specifies a horizontal spin button (note that this style is not supported in wxGTK).

option.name: wxSP_ARROW_KEYS
option.help: The user can use arrow keys to change the value.

option.name: wxSP_WRAP
option.help: The value wraps at the minimum and maximum.

event.name: OnSpin
event.help: Generated whenever an arrow is pressed.

event.name: OnSpinUp
event.help: Generated when left/up arrow is pressed.

event.name: OnSpinDown
event.help: Generated when right/down arrow is pressed.

property.name: label
property.help: Text of the hyperlink

property.name: url
property.help: Target of the hyperlink

property.name: hover_color
property.help: The colour used to print the label of the hyperlink when the mouse is over the control.

property.name: normal_color
property.help: The colour used to print the label when the link has never been clicked before (i.e. the link has not been visited) and the mouse is not over the control.

property.name: visited_color
property.help: The colour used to print the label when the mouse is not over the control and the link has already been clicked before (i.e. the link has been visited).

event.name: OnHyperlink
event.help: The hyperlink was (left) clicked. If this event is not handled in user's code (or it's skipped; see wxEvent::Skip), then a call to wxLaunchDefaultBrowser is done with the hyperlink's URL.

property.name: defaultfolder
property.help: Initial Directory.

property.name: filter
property.help: A filter string, using the same syntax as that for wxFileDialog. This may be empty if filters are not being used. Example: "All files (*.*)|*.*|JPEG files (*.jpg)|*.jpg".

property.name: defaultfilter
property.help: The zero-indexed default filter setting.

property.name: show_hidden
property.help: Show hidden files

event.name: OnDirctrlSelectionChanged
event.help: Selected directory has changed. Processes a wxEVT_DIRCTRL_SELECTIONCHANGED event type. Notice that this event is generated even for the changes done by the program itself and not only those done by the user. Available since wxWidgets 2.9.5.

event.name: OnDirctrlFileActivated
event.help: The user activated a file by double-clicking or pressing Enter. Available since wxWidgets 2.9.5.

property.name: file
property.help: The path to media file.

property.name: play
property.help: Play the media file.

property.name: playback_rate
property.help: Sets the playback rate, or speed of the media, to that referred by dRate. 1.0 represents normal speed, while 2.0 represents twice the normal speed of the media, for example. Not supported on the GStreamer (Unix) backend.

property.name: volume
property.help: Sets the volume of the media from a 0.0 to 1.0 range to that referred by dVolume. 1.0 represents full volume, while 0.5 represents half (50 percent) volume, for example. Note that this may not be exact due to conversion and rounding errors, although setting the volume to full or none is always exact.

option.name: STEP
option.help: wxMEDIACTRLPLAYERCONTROLS_STEP, Step controls like fastfoward, step one frame etc.

option.name: VOLUME
option.help: wxMEDIACTRLPLAYERCONTROLS_VOLUME, Volume controls like the speaker icon, volume slider, etc.

option.name: DEFAULT
option.help: wxMEDIACTRLPLAYERCONTROLS_DEFAULT, Default controls for the toolkit. Currently a typedef for wxMEDIACTRLPLAYERCONTROLS_STEP and wxMEDIACTRLPLAYERCONTROLS_VOLUME.

option.name: NONE
option.help: wxMEDIACTRLPLAYERCONTROLS_NONE, No controls. return wxMediaCtrl to it's default state.

property.name: name
property.help: The control is added to a sizer using this name.

property.name: class
property.help: The control is generated to XRC with this class.

property.name: declaration
property.help: Code to generate for the declaration of this control.

property.name: construction
property.help: Code to generate for the construction of this control.

property.name: include
property.help: Code to generate for the include statements for this control.

property.name: settings
property.help: Code to generate for the settings of this control.

property.name: name
property.help: wxTimer object name.

property.name: id
property.help: Timer identifier.

property.name: period
property.help: Timer period in milliseconds.

property.name: enabled
property.help: Enable timer on startup.

property.name: oneshot
property.help: Produce timer event just once.

event.name: OnTimer
event.help: Process a wxEVT_TIMER event, when the timer ticks.
